title: The Future of React: Server Components Explained
excerpt: Dive deep into how Server Components are reshaping the way we build performant web applications in 2024 and beyond.
content:
React Server Components (RSC) represent one of the most significant architectural shifts in the React ecosystem since hooks were introduced.

Why the Shift?

Traditional React applications force the browser to download, parse, and execute large bundles of JavaScript. With RSC, the server handles the heavy lifting.

Key Benefits

  • Zero Bundle Size: Server components aren't included in the client bundle.
  • Direct Backend Access: Access databases directly from your components.
  • Automatic Code Splitting: The framework handles splitting automatically.
author: Nevinas

title: Mastering Tailwind CSS: From Zero to Hero
excerpt: Stop fighting with CSS files. Learn how utility-first CSS can speed up your development workflow by 200%.
content:
Tailwind CSS has completely transformed how developers think about styling. Instead of arbitrary class names, we compose styles directly in markup.

The Utility-First Workflow

The constraints Tailwind provides ensure your design remains consistent while allowing for infinite flexibility.

"After building one project with Tailwind, I never want to go back to vanilla CSS."
author: Nevinas

title: The Psychology of Minimalist Web Design
excerpt: Why less is often more. Understanding cognitive load and how whitespace improves user retention.
content:
Minimalism is not just an aesthetic choice; it is a functional one. Clarity is the most valuable asset a website can offer.

Key Principles

  • Whitespace is content: Empty space gives your design room to breathe.
  • Typography hierarchy: Guide the eye with size, weight, and color.
  • Reduce choices: Fewer options lead to faster decisions.
author: Nevinas

title: Building a MERN Stack Portfolio from Scratch
excerpt: A complete walkthrough of creating a developer portfolio with MongoDB, Express, React, and Node.js.
content:
The MERN stack is one of the most popular full-stack combinations for JavaScript developers.

Architecture

The frontend is built with React 19 and TypeScript, using Vite for lightning-fast HMR. Tailwind CSS 4 handles styling with a custom theme system.

Backend

Express 5 serves the REST API with Mongoose as the ODM for MongoDB.

Key Takeaways

  • Always start with a clear data model design
  • Use TypeScript from day one
  • Theme systems save time in the long run
author: Nevinas

title: Why TypeScript is Worth the Learning Curve
excerpt: From skeptic to advocate: how static typing transformed my development workflow and reduced bugs by 60%.
content:
When I first encountered TypeScript, I thought it was unnecessary overhead. After six months of using it in production, the investment is absolutely worth it.

Type Safety Catches Bugs Early

The compiler catches errors at build time that would otherwise only appear at runtime.

Better Developer Experience

IntelliSense provides autocomplete, inline documentation, and refactoring tools that make development significantly faster.
author: Nevinas

title: Running Python in the Browser with Pyodide
excerpt: How WebAssembly enables full Python runtime in the browser — and how I used it in ComTech-Prep.
content:
One of the most exciting features of ComTech-Prep is executing Python code directly in the browser via Pyodide (Python compiled to WebAssembly).

How It Works

Pyodide loads the CPython interpreter into the browser. You can execute Python, import packages, and interact with JavaScript objects.

Integration with Monaco Editor

We paired Pyodide with Monaco Editor to create a full code editing experience with syntax highlighting, autocomplete, and execution — all client-side.
author: Nevinas
